body.p: Both of your letters came to hand, in due time & I insure you I was glad to hear from you and to hear that you werwere enjoying good health. Dear Walt, I beg to be excused for not writing sooner, but to tell the truth we have had a good many visitors and when there was not visitors I was away, but you need not think that I have forgottonforgotten you. Your memory burns as bright as ever in my heart & allwaysalways will, thearthere is now doubt but some of my corrospondantscorrespondents in Washington has begin to think hard of me for not writing oftener, but I will be thearthere my self before long to make excuses'esexcuses in person. I will be thearthere on the last day of August, if I do not get my furlowfurlough extended, whitchwhich I have the hopes of, for I would most as leave come back to see my old friends as stay at home. The Doctor that tens me hear wants me for to try and get my furlowfurlough extended, for he thinks that my leg will get worse if I go back while the weather is so hot, but I do not know how it will be yet (wont you advise me which is best) The Doctor thinks that he can have my furlowfurlough extended verryvery easy. Dear Walter I am enjoying my self fine as well, I think, as any cripple can. I was up to Quaker or Friends QuartilyQuarterly Meeting yesterday. (I expect you know what it is and may be have binbeen at one) thearthere was a great many thearthere & I seen a great many of my relations & freindsfriends thearthere that I would not of seen if I had of stayed away. they had exelantexcellent preaching, but you must know that they are are on the Piece principle, and you know that I aintain't. I am for war as long as there is men & money until this sccussed Rebellion is put down for thearthere has binbeen to many good lives lost allreadyalready for to ever make a compromise, do not you think so.

Well Dear Walter, it is just in the highthheight of the Peach & Appelapple season and we have some nice Peaches but we have not got any Apples now for our early ons are dun and we have not many late ones. We have some few Watermellonswatermelons & cantilopescantaloupes but not many I often think of the poor boys in the Hospital when I am eating them

Walter I have no news to write so I will have to close this miserable scrachscratch for I am aware that it is verryvery porelypoorly wrote (but I never mind the writing if the heart is all wright) so you must not mind this so with mutchmuch love to you; and all enquiring friends I will bid you good by and God bless you from your friend and companion.
